wikipedia_page.main: Major Francis Jones CVO, TD, DL, FSA, MA, KStJ (5 July 1908 – 14 December 1993) was an author, archivist, historian and officer of arms.

response: **Francis Jones CVO, TD, DL, FSA, MA, KStJ, Welsh historian and officer of arms (b. 1908)

There was formerly a Wales Herald in the late fourteenth century, but that office was short-lived.  The post was re-established in 1963 as an Officer of Arms Extraordinary, its first appointee being Francis Jones.
*Francis Jones (historian) (1908–1993), Welsh author, archivist, historian and officer of arms
*Francis Jones (American politician), U.S. Representative from Tennessee, 1817–1823
*Francis Jones (Canadian politician) (1815–1887), Conservative MP of the Province of Canada and Parliament of Canada 1861–1874
*Francis Jones (Lord Mayor) (1559–1622), English merchant and Lord Mayor of London, 1620
*Francis Jones (physicist) (1914–1988), co-developer of Oboe blind bombing system, chief scientist, AAE Farnborough
**Francis Jones is appointed to the newly-formed Prince of Wales ' Investiture Committee.
